name: Purple (2000s)

visual_treatment.color_palette: Desaturated with selective pops of neon, heavy use of blacks and grays, occasional stark whites, muted pastels, and signature purple accents
visual_treatment.lighting: Natural, unpolished lighting with harsh shadows, fluorescent office lighting, flash photography creating stark contrasts, often underexposed
visual_treatment.contrast: High contrast black and white mixed with low-contrast color work, deliberately muddy mid-tones
visual_treatment.texture: Heavy grain, digital artifacts, photocopied aesthetics, deliberately lo-fi with visible compression and pixelation

composition.framing: Unconventional crops, off-center subjects, documentary-style candids, awkward poses that feel unstaged
composition.spatial_relationships: Cramped urban environments, cluttered backgrounds, subjects often dwarfed by architecture or technology
composition.perspectives: Street-level viewpoints, voyeuristic angles, handheld camera instability, anti-glamorous positioning
composition.layout_philosophy: Anti-design approach with clashing typefaces, asymmetrical layouts, intentional visual discord

technical.film_or_technology: Early digital cameras mixed with cheap film stocks, disposable cameras, camera phones, deliberately amateur equipment
technical.lens_character: Wide-angle distortion, plastic lens aberrations, built-in flash creating flat lighting, no lens corrections
technical.post_processing: Minimal retouching, preserved digital noise, oversaturated color channels, deliberate technical 'mistakes'

cultural_context.values: Anti-establishment, underground authenticity, rejection of mainstream beauty standards, celebration of outsider culture
cultural_context.subject_matter: Street fashion, underground music scenes, youth subcultures, urban decay, technology integration into daily life
cultural_context.target_audience: Art students, underground fashion enthusiasts, early adopters of digital culture, anti-commercial creatives
cultural_context.era_signature: Bridging analog punk aesthetics with early digital culture, pre-social media authenticity

temporal_markers: Early digital camera artifacts and compression
Flip phone and early internet cafe environments
distinguishing_features: Deliberately amateur aesthetic that influenced later 'authentic' social media photography, pioneering the anti-glossy movement in fashion photography, mixing high fashion with lo-fi presentation
